Document.TEXT: Classified in: DUBLIN , Jan. 14, 2016 /PRNewswire/ -- Research and Markets ( http://www.researchandmarkets.com/research/f396lz/global_forging ) has announced the addition of the Global Forging Market 2016-2020 report to their offering. The report predicts the global forging market to exhibit a healthy CAGR of around 8% during the forecast period. Vendors are developing new and improved die material interfaces and increasingly using new die designs and modeling software. The market is also implementing controls and sensors to monitor the forging process in a bid to automatically sense and compensate for any variation in the process. According to the report, the aerospace industry is one of the key end-users of the forging market. Forged components are extensively used in building commercial and defense aircraft. Structural strength is an important parameter in the design and manufacture of aircraft. The industry demands materials with high strength-to-weight ratios in order to manufacture forged components such as bulkheads, wing roots, hinges, spars, engine mounts, beams, brackets, wheels, landing gear cylinders and struts, and brake carriers. Further, the report states that the automotive industry is the biggest end-user of forged parts. The global economic slowdown has adversely affected the growth of the industry. Following this, the sales of forged parts in this industry lowered in 2015. This has compelled vendors of the forging market to reduce their shares and investments in the automotive industry.
